Interface TwoDBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameOfLifeBoard
public interface TwoDBoard

An interface the defines how to use a board on Conway's Game of Life.

Your GameOfLifeBoard class will implement this interface. Your GameOfLifeBoard will have a 2-D Cell array instance field (member data). When you instantiate the Cells in the array, you will call the GameOfLifeCell constructor.

Author:
sm053

Method Summary
 void changeState(int x, int y)
          Inverts the state of the cell at the given coordinate on the board.
 int getSize()
          Return the size of the game board.
 boolean isAlive(int x, int y)
          Returns true if the cell at the given coordinate on the board is alive, otherwise returns false.
 void setBirthConditions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> cond)
          Declares the number of neighbors required for a cell to be born after a step in the simulation of the board.
 void setStayAliveConditions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> cond)
          Declares the number of neighbors required for a cell to stay alive after a step in the simulation of the board The GameOfLife calls this method.
 boolean[][] toArray()
          Creates a two-dimensional array representing the game board.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns an ASCII representation of the board's current state.
 void undo()
          Reverts all cells on the board to the state defined in the previous generation.
 void update()
          Calculates the next state of each cell and updates the game board to the next generation.
 

Method Detail

undo

void undo()
Reverts all cells on the board to the state defined in the previous generation. The GameOfLife calls this method.

update

void update()
Calculates the next state of each cell and updates the game board to the next generation. The GameOfLife calls this method.

toString

java.lang.String toString()
Returns an ASCII representation of the board's current state. ASCII means a String that can be printed at the console and looks like the board with some characters representing live cell and dead cells (X and O or * and a space). The ASCII drawing will also need characters to represent the grid that the cells are in (_ and |). Carefully decide if the cell at location [0][0] should be printed at the top left or bottom left. Where did the GUI put this cell? The GameOfLife calls this method.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
an ASCII representation of the board

isAlive

boolean isAlive(int x,
                int y)
Returns true if the cell at the given coordinate on the board is alive, otherwise returns false. This method calls a Cell method and returns the answer. The GameOfLife calls this method.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the queried cell
y - the y-coordinate of the queried cell
Returns:
the current liveness condition of the queried cell

changeState

void changeState(int x,
                 int y)
Inverts the state of the cell at the given coordinate on the board. If the cell was alive, it will now be dead. If it was dead, it will now be alive. This method calls a Cell method. The GameOfLife calls this method.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the queried cell
y - the y-coordinate of the queried cell

getSize

int getSize()
Return the size of the game board. For example, a 15x15 board will return a size of 15. The GameOfLife calls this method.

Returns:
the size of the game board

toArray

boolean[][] toArray()
Creates a two-dimensional array representing the game board. The array will be full of booleans representing whether each Cell is alive. The GameOfLife calls this method.

Returns:
the 2-d array of the game board

setBirthConditions

void setBirthConditions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> cond)
Declares the number of neighbors required for a cell to be born after a step in the simulation of the board. The GameOfLife calls this method. This method also calls setBirthConditions method in GameOfLifeCell.

Parameters:
cond - ArrayList of integers representing the number of neighbors for which a cell on the board will be born

setStayAliveConditions

void setStayAliveConditions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> cond)
Declares the number of neighbors required for a cell to stay alive after a step in the simulation of the board The GameOfLife calls this method. This method also calls setStayAliveConditions method in GameOfLifeCell.

Parameters:
cond - ArrayList of integers representing the number of neighbors for which a cell on the board will stay alive
